snippet: A new nonpartisan study confronts the legacy of brutality against detainees by the Bush administration.
abstract: Editorial welcomes sweeping report, issued by Constitution Project task force, on interrogation and detention programs carried out in aftermath of terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001; contends that it is impossible to dismiss report's conclusion that United States engaged in torture; calls for release of separate Senate Intelligence Committee report with no further delay.
lead_paragraph: A new nonpartisan study confronts the legacy of brutality against detainees by the Bush administration.
